meanings.definition: Weels (noun): circular objects on a vehicle that rotate and enable movement
meanings.sent1: The weels on the car spun quickly as it raced down the road.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic checked the weels of the bicycle for any signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The weels on the toy truck made it zoom around the room, much to the delight of the child.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move like weels spinning faster and faster as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The weels of progress never stop turning, always propelling us forward.

meanings.definition: Weels (verb): to turn or spin around rapidly
meanings.sent1: The dancer weels gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent2: The colorful pinwheel weels in the breeze, creating a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent3: The cat weels around in excitement when it sees its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts weel in my mind, swirling like a whirlpool of ideas.
meanings.sent5: Emotions can weel up inside us, sometimes overflowing like a river bursting its banks.
